page.title: 09THE VILLAGE BAKERY, FAIR OAK
page.content: The Oven Door Bakery opened 13 years ago to bring "real" bread to the village of Fair Oak. The day for the baker and his staff of seven begins at 4a.m. and finishes after cleaning up at about 6p.m. First task is the preparation of morning-goods - bread, rolls etc. Then follows throughout the day an endless succession of doughnuts,scones and cakes both large and small; fruit flans in summer and Christmas cakes later. In all, 8 varieties of loaf are made and in a typical week, well over a hundred and fifty dozen loaves are baked. In addition, a large selection of pizzas,filled rolls and quiches supply the midday needs of pupils from the local school and the requirements of the baker's many regular customers.
